comments.creator: jhopkins@mozilla.com
comments.text:
I'm using Thunderbird 6.0a2 (2011-06-17) against an IMAP server.

While I drag and drop a message from the message list over the folder list, Thunderbird hilights a folder, then the space between two folders, then the next folder, etc.  If I drop a message between two folders, the drag and drop action is cancelled.
I suggest that since dropping a message between two folders is invalid, Thunderbird should not offer a "space" between two folders and, instead, hilight whichever folder the mouse pointer is closest to.
Interestingly, dragging a folder over other folders does not offer space between folders and operates the way I would expect.
